com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments.csb
Class SimpleNavigationEnvironment

java.lang.Object
  com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments.csb.Environment
      com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments.csb.SimpleNavigationEnvironment
All Implemented Interfaces:
Configurable
public class SimpleNavigationEnvironment
extends Environment

Implements an environment that essentially represents a simple navigation like task. The agent perceives the current state as is (no transformation is performed between the environments current state and the agents perception of it). The agent can directly move around within the Cartesian space represented by the environment state space: the agents output is interpreted as a motion vector which changes the current state in a linear additive way. The reward signal, which is the Euclidean distance from the current environment state to the goal state, is provided directly to the agent.

Environments can optionally have (hyper-)spherical obstacles added at random locations (increasing the environment difficulty increases the number of obstacles). The agent cannot directly perceive the obstacles. If the environment size (dimensionality) is 2 then the images generated by RLContinuousStateBased will include the obstacle locations.

Field Detail

OBSTACLE_COUNT_INITIAL

public static final java.lang.String OBSTACLE_COUNT_INITIAL
The initial number of obstacles that should be included. Default is 0.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OBSTACLE_COUNT_INCREASE_DELTA

public static final java.lang.String OBSTACLE_COUNT_INCREASE_DELTA
The amount to increase the obstacle count when environments with the current value have been sufficiently mastered (see RLContinuousStateBased.DIFFICULTY_INCREASE_PERFORMANCE. If the value is followed by an "x" then the value is considered a factor (and so should be > 1). Default is 1.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OBSTACLE_COUNT_MAX

public static final java.lang.String OBSTACLE_COUNT_MAX
The maximum amount to increase the obstacle count to. Default is lots.

See Also:

updateStateAndOutput

public void updateStateAndOutput(org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector state,
                                 double[] input,
                                 double[] output)
Description copied from class: Environment
This function should do three things: (1) update the given state given the input; (2) update the given state internally if the environment is dynamic (changes even when if the agent provides no "actions"), and (3) update/set the output based on the new current state.

Description copied from class: Environment
Return true iff it is possible to (further) increase the difficulty of environments of this type, eg by introducing a larger number of obstacles, a more convoluted transform between state and output, etc.

increaseDifficulty

public void increaseDifficulty()
Description copied from class: Environment
Adjust the variables determining difficulty to increase the difficulty of environment instances generated by this environment type. The Environment.setUp(int) method will be called immediately after calling this method to generate a new environment instance.
